Class TileScene

java.lang.Object
  com.trolltech.qt.internal.QSignalEmitterInternal
      com.trolltech.qt.QSignalEmitter

                  com.trolltech.qt.gui.QGraphicsScene
                      edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.gui.TileScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.trolltech.qt.QtJambiInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
DesignTileScene, DeviceBrowserScene
public class TileScene
extends com.trolltech.qt.gui.QGraphicsScene

This class is used for the design explorer although, it could be used for building other applications as well.

Author:
Chris Lavin

Constructor Detail

TileScene

public TileScene()
Empty constructor

TileScene

public TileScene(Design design,
                 boolean hideTiles,
                 boolean drawPrimitives)
Creates a new tile scene with a design.

Parameters:
design - The design and device to associate with this scene.
hideTiles - A flag to hide/show certain tiles to make the fabric appear more homogeneous.
drawPrimitives - A flag to draw boxes to represent primitives.

TileScene

public TileScene(Device device,
                 boolean hideTiles,
                 boolean drawPrimitives)
Creates a new tile scene with a device.

Parameters:
device - The device to associate with this scene.
hideTiles - A flag to hide/show certain tiles to make the fabric appear more homogeneous.
drawPrimitives - A flag to draw boxes to represent primitives.

getTile

public Tile getTile(double x,
                    double y)
Gets the tile based on the x and y coordinates given (typically from mouse input)

Parameters:
x - The x location on the screen.
y - The y location on the screen.
Returns:
The tile at the x,y location or null if none exist.

getTile

public Tile getTile(com.trolltech.qt.gui.QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent event)
Gets the tile based on the mouse position in the event.

Parameters:
event - The recent mouse event
Returns:
The tile under which the mouse event occurred.
